author: Special Correspondent
text:
Three unidentified persons barged into the house of a retired headmaster and attacked him with an iron rod in a bid to rob valuables from the family members under Usilampatti Town police station limits in the small hours of Monday.

However, the robbers had fled the scene after the retired headmaster, R. Jayapal (68), and his son J. Satheeshkumar (35), also a teacher, put up resistance.

The police said that Mr. Jayapal, his wife, son and daughter-in-law were fast asleep in the house at Maruthi Nagar, when the robbers managed to enter the house by breaking open the door locked from inside.

The robbers, who wore no shirts but only half trousers, first attacked Mr. Jayapal with an iron rod on his thigh, Deputy Superintendent of Police (Usilampatti) S. Ramakrishnan said.

After gagging him, they asked him to hand over jewels and cash to them.

In the meantime, Mr. Satheeshkumar, who was sleeping in the adjacent room, was woken up by the noise.

When he tried to overpower one of them, he too was attacked with a og. The robbers, who felt that they might be caught, pushed Mr. Satheeshkumar aside and fled the scene.

Usilampatti Town police are investigating.
title: Armed robbers attack retired headmaster, son
